stem: A mass casualty incident has occurred at a local stadium. As the triage nurse, categorize the following clients using the START triage system.

tabs.title: Nurses' Notes
tabs.content:
10:15, Report from EMS: Multiple casualties reported at stadium collapse. ETA 5 minutes. 

10:20, Triage initiated. Prioritizing patients based on START triage protocol.

10:25, Patient #1 (John Doe): Appears unconscious, RR 8, weak carotid pulse. 

10:30, Patient #2 (Jane Smith): Open femur fracture, RR 24, able to follow commands. 

10:35, Patient #3 (Carlos Garcia): Minor lacerations, RR 20, ambulatory, anxious. 

10:40, Patient #4 (Maria Rodriguez): No respirations after positioning airway. 

10:45, Patient #5 (David Lee): RR 32, altered mental status, capillary refill >2 seconds after repositioning. 

10:50, Resources stretched. Requesting additional support. Continue triage.

rows.text: John Doe: Unconscious, RR 8, weak pulse.
Jane Smith: Open femur fracture, RR 24, follows commands.
Carlos Garcia: Minor lacerations, RR 20, ambulatory.
Maria Rodriguez: No respirations after airway positioning.
David Lee: RR 32, altered mental status, cap refill >2 seconds.

answerBreakdown.text: John Doe: Unconscious, RR 8, weak pulse.
answerBreakdown.rationale: John Doe requires immediate intervention due to his decreased respiratory rate (below 10) and altered level of consciousness. According to START triage, patients with respirations <10 or >30 or altered mental status are tagged as Red (Immediate).

answerBreakdown.text: Jane Smith: Open femur fracture, RR 24, follows commands.
answerBreakdown.rationale: Jane Smith has an open femur fracture but is alert, breathing within normal limits, and can follow commands. This warrants a Yellow (Delayed) tag, indicating she needs treatment but can wait a short period.

answerBreakdown.text: Carlos Garcia: Minor lacerations, RR 20, ambulatory.
answerBreakdown.rationale: Carlos Garcia is ambulatory and has minor lacerations, indicating he is a Green (Minor) priority. These patients are considered 'walking wounded' and can wait for treatment.

answerBreakdown.text: Maria Rodriguez: No respirations after airway positioning.
answerBreakdown.rationale: Maria Rodriguez has no respirations even after airway positioning. According to START triage, if a patient does not spontaneously breathe after an airway is opened, they are tagged as Black (Expectant) as resources are focused on patients with a higher chance of survival.

answerBreakdown.text: David Lee: RR 32, altered mental status, cap refill >2 seconds.
answerBreakdown.rationale: David Lee has a respiratory rate above 30, altered mental status, and delayed capillary refill. Any of these findings indicate an immediate threat to life, mandating a Red (Immediate) tag.

clinicalPearls: The START triage system is designed for rapid assessment and prioritization of patients during mass casualty incidents.
Key assessments include respirations, perfusion, and mental status.
Remember the '30, Can Do, Not Breathing' rule: RR >30 = Red, Can Do (follow commands) = Yellow, Not Breathing (after airway) = Black.

questionTrap.trap: Confusing patients with injuries that look severe but are not immediately life-threatening with those who have subtle but critical respiratory or perfusion issues.
questionTrap.howToOvercome: Focus on the ABCs (airway, breathing, circulation) and use the START triage algorithm to guide decision-making.

mnemonic.title: RPM
mnemonic.expansion: Respirations, Perfusion, Mental Status: The key components of the START triage system.
